  "description": "Fave consulting is a Human Resources Management and consultancy firm that specializes in strategic HR management to enhance business growth, performance and transformation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Female Receptionist / Customer Relations Officer (CRO)

Job Location:&nbsp;Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full Time (Monday - Saturday)

Job Summary


	The Customer Relations Officer (CRO) will be responsible for ensuring that all clients receive an outstanding and memorable experience.
	You will be required to ensure an effective management of the spa journey, including appointments/reservations, loyalty rewards, memberships, treatments, and retailing.
	You will also be responsible for handling social media accounts with specific campaigns aimed at achieving membership subscriptions, business objectives and spa profitability (increased sales).


Key Responsibilities


	Hands-on management of client data, spa treatments, timings, appointment bookings (online &amp; offline), loyalty rewards and membership subscriptions on a full-time basis.
	Ensuring consistency of service and safety protocols, appropriate and correct pricing, issuing of receipts, correct filling out of client forms and client satisfaction on every interaction.
	Communicate with spa manager and spa director to ensure smooth day-to-day operations, including purchasing requirements, client requests &amp; feedback.
	Collaborate with the Spa Manager on revenue initiatives, service enhancements, incentive programs, marketing and brand development.
	Create social media campaigns to increase online followership and presence, increase retail sales and client loyalty.
	Managing all our social media accounts (Facebook, Twitter and Instagram). In order to do this effectively, you must take photos of clients&#39; finished treatments using the shop camera.
	Marketing of spa memberships with a monthly target of 10 members.
	Representing the company at trade fairs and external events within Abuja and outside if necessary.
	Effective management of our sister brand &ldquo;Amali Cosmetics&rdquo; includes sales and inventory management.
	Other duties as assigned.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a B.Sc. or HND qualification
	1-3 years of hands-on experience in the beauty sector
	Ability to maintain and promote a long-lasting relationship with our clients.
	Educate and guide the client based on their specific needs.
	Must be adaptable to change and able to multitask calmly and efficiently, with an emphasis on follow-up, cooperation and courtesy.
	Excellent verbal, written and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent interpersonal, leadership and listening skills. Must be highly organised and detail-oriented.
	Knowledge of the best practices and industry trends is essential.
	Knowledge of computerized spa booking software, Excel, MS Office, and point of sale systems is an asset.
	Knowledge of social media management and digital marketing.


Salary
N100,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter in PDF to:&nbsp;recruitment@faveconsulting.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Female Receptionist / Customer Relations Officer (CRO) Job at Fave Consulting




        
    

        
        Fave consulting is a Human Resources Management and consultancy firm that specializes in strategic HR management to enhance business growth, performance and transformation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Female Receptionist / Customer Relations Officer (CRO)

Job Location: Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full Time (Monday - Saturday)

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Customer Relations Officer (CRO) will be responsible for ensuring that all clients receive an outstanding and memorable experience.
	You will be required to ensure an effective management of the spa journey, including appointments/reservations, loyalty rewards, memberships, treatments, and retailing.
	You will also be responsible for handling social media accounts with specific campaigns aimed at achieving membership subscriptions, business objectives and spa profitability (increased sales).


Key Responsibilities


	Hands-on management of client data, spa treatments, timings, appointment bookings (online & offline), loyalty rewards and membership subscriptions on a full-time basis.
	Ensuring consistency of service and safety protocols, appropriate and correct pricing, issuing of receipts, correct filling out of client forms and client satisfaction on every interaction.
	Communicate with spa manager and spa director to ensure smooth day-to-day operations, including purchasing requirements, client requests & feedback.
	Collaborate with the Spa Manager on revenue initiatives, service enhancements, incentive programs, marketing and brand development.
	Create social media campaigns to increase online followership and presence, increase retail sales and client loyalty.
	Managing all our social media accounts (Facebook, Twitter and Instagram). In order to do this effectively, you must take photos of clients' finished treatments using the shop camera.
	Marketing of spa memberships with a monthly target of 10 members.
	Representing the company at trade fairs and external events within Abuja and outside if necessary.
	Effective management of our sister brand “Amali Cosmetics” includes sales and inventory management.
	Other duties as assigned.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a B.Sc. or HND qualification
	1-3 years of hands-on experience in the beauty sector
	Ability to maintain and promote a long-lasting relationship with our clients.
	Educate and guide the client based on their specific needs.
	Must be adaptable to change and able to multitask calmly and efficiently, with an emphasis on follow-up, cooperation and courtesy.
	Excellent verbal, written and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent interpersonal, leadership and listening skills. Must be highly organised and detail-oriented.
	Knowledge of the best practices and industry trends is essential.
	Knowledge of computerized spa booking software, Excel, MS Office, and point of sale systems is an asset.
	Knowledge of social media management and digital marketing.


Salary
N100,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter in PDF to: recruitment@faveconsulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Cloud Program Manager Job at DeepSource




        
    

        
        At DeepSource, we excel in connecting businesses with top-tier multilingual talent, specializing in Information Technology and Artificial Intelligence. Our expertise lies in sourcing highly skilled professionals and providing tailored talent solutions that enable companies to accelerate growth, drive innovation, and embrace digital transformation. As your trusted partner, DeepSource empowers you to find the right talent and harness AI-driven solutions, ensuring your business remains competitive and agile in today’s dynamic digital landscape.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cloud Program Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	As a Cloud Program Manager, you will collaborate with technical teams, stakeholders, and clients to deliver seamless integration of cloud technology into their existing infrastructure.
	You will play a vital role in managing projects from conception through execution and will be responsible for achieving business objectives while optimizing the use of resources.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead end-to-end project management for cloud implementation and migration projects, including planning, execution, monitoring, and closure.
	Collaborate with solution architects and technical teams to design and implement effective cloud solutions tailored to client needs.
	Develop and maintain project documentation, including project plans, timelines, status reports, and risk assessments.
	Manage stakeholder expectations and facilitate communication between technical teams and clients to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.
	Identify project risks and issues proactively, ensuring timely resolution and minimizing impact on project timelines.
	Conduct regular project meetings, providing updates to stakeholders and ensuring open lines of communication throughout the project lifecycle.
	Monitor and report on project performance against established KPIs and success criteria.
	Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging cloud technologies to drive continuous improvement and innovation.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field; Master’s degree is a plus.
	8+ years of experience in project management, with a focus on cloud-based solutions and infrastructure.
	Proven experience managing cloud projects, preferably in a SaaS or IT consulting environment.
	Strong understanding of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and related technologies.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects concurrently.
	Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, capable of working effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels.
	Professional certifications (e.g., PMP, AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Administrator) are highly desirable.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
	Experience with project management tools (e.g., Jira, Trello, MS Project).
	A proactive, results-oriented mindset with the ability to adapt quickly to changing project requirements.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HR Manager",
  "description": "Universal Human Resource Consult is a human resource consulting firm that effectively manages private and government organization by ensuring adequate staff recruitment and selection, staff training and co-ordination thereby creating sustainable growth and increase quality of service delivery in organizations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Manager&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The HR Manager is responsible for overseeing all aspects of the hotel&rsquo;s human resources operations, including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, compensation and benefits, and compliance with labor laws.
	The role ensures that the hotel attracts, retains, and develops qualified personnel who deliver excellent service in alignment with the hotel&rsquo;s culture, policies, and brand standards.


Key Responsibilities
Recruitment &amp; Staffing:


	Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract qualified candidates for all departments.
	Coordinate end-to-end recruitment processesadvertising, shortlisting, interviewing, and onboarding.
	Ensure staffing levels are maintained to meet operational needs.
	Work closely with department heads to identify manpower requirements and succession plans.


Employee Relations &amp; Engagement:


	Foster a positive and inclusive work environment that promotes teamwork and high performance.
	Handle employee grievances, conflicts, and disciplinary actions in line with company policies and labor laws.
	Conduct regular staff meetings, employee satisfaction surveys, and engagement activities.
	Promote the hotel&rsquo;s culture, values, and brand ethos through employee engagement programs.


Performance Management:


	Develop and manage performance appraisal systems to evaluate staff performance and identify improvement areas.
	Work with department heads to set performance goals and KPIs.
	Monitor and guide managers on handling underperformance and employee development plans.


Training &amp; Development:


	Identify training needs and coordinate learning and development programs for all departments.
	Implement orientation and onboarding programs for new employees.
	Monitor the effectiveness of training programs and maintain training records.
	Encourage career growth, internal promotions, and skill enhancement across teams.


Compensation &amp; Benefits:


	Administer employee payroll, benefits, and incentive programs in collaboration with the Finance Department.
	Review and recommend competitive compensation structures in line with market standards.
	Ensure timely and accurate processing of salary, leave, and statutory deductions.


Compliance &amp; Policy Management:


	Ensure compliance with labor laws, health and safety regulations, and hotel policies.
	Maintain accurate HR records, personnel files, and documentation.
	Update and enforce HR policies, employee handbooks, and disciplinary procedures.
	Manage staff attendance, leave, and timekeeping systems.


HR Strategy &amp; Reporting:


	Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with the hotel&rsquo;s operational goals.
	Prepare monthly HR reports including staff turnover, recruitment status, and training metrics.
	Advise management on HR trends, workforce planning, and policy improvements.





Qualifications &amp; Experience


	B.Sc.in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or related fields
	Minimum of 5 years of HR experience, with at least 2 years in a managerial role within the hospitality industry.
	Professional HR certification (CIPM, SHRM, CIPD) is an added advantage.
	Proven experience in recruitment, employee relations, and HR operations in a hotel or service-oriented environment.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong leadership and interpersonal skills.
	Excellent communication and conflict resolution abilities.

Employment Type: Full-time

	The HR Manager is responsible for overseeing all aspects of the hotel’s human resources operations, including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, compensation and benefits, and compliance with labor laws.
	The role ensures that the hotel attracts, retains, and develops qualified personnel who deliver excellent service in alignment with the hotel’s culture, policies, and brand standards.


Key Responsibilities
Recruitment & Staffing:


	Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract qualified candidates for all departments.
	Coordinate end-to-end recruitment processesadvertising, shortlisting, interviewing, and onboarding.
	Ensure staffing levels are maintained to meet operational needs.
	Work closely with department heads to identify manpower requirements and succession plans.


Employee Relations & Engagement:


	Foster a positive and inclusive work environment that promotes teamwork and high performance.
	Handle employee grievances, conflicts, and disciplinary actions in line with company policies and labor laws.
	Conduct regular staff meetings, employee satisfaction surveys, and engagement activities.
	Promote the hotel’s culture, values, and brand ethos through employee engagement programs.


Performance Management:


	Develop and manage performance appraisal systems to evaluate staff performance and identify improvement areas.
	Work with department heads to set performance goals and KPIs.
	Monitor and guide managers on handling underperformance and employee development plans.


Training & Development:


	Identify training needs and coordinate learning and development programs for all departments.
	Implement orientation and onboarding programs for new employees.
	Monitor the effectiveness of training programs and maintain training records.
	Encourage career growth, internal promotions, and skill enhancement across teams.


Compensation & Benefits:


	Administer employee payroll, benefits, and incentive programs in collaboration with the Finance Department.
	Review and recommend competitive compensation structures in line with market standards.
	Ensure timely and accurate processing of salary, leave, and statutory deductions.


Compliance & Policy Management:


	Ensure compliance with labor laws, health and safety regulations, and hotel policies.
	Maintain accurate HR records, personnel files, and documentation.
	Update and enforce HR policies, employee handbooks, and disciplinary procedures.
	Manage staff attendance, leave, and timekeeping systems.


HR Strategy & Reporting:


	Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with the hotel’s operational goals.
	Prepare monthly HR reports including staff turnover, recruitment status, and training metrics.
	Advise management on HR trends, workforce planning, and policy improvements.
